archetype_name: Family Weekend Showstopper: Indian Feast Night
name: Lucknow-Style Lamb Galouti Kebab Feast with Jeera Rice and Kachumber
description: Melt-in-the-mouth spiced lamb kebabs paired with fragrant cumin basmati rice and a fresh lemony kachumber salad. A weekend showpiece with layered aromas and a restaurant-style finish.
prep_steps: Preheat oven to 240°C/465°F with a rack in the upper third.
Rinse 2 cups basmati rice in cold water until it runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Finely grate 1 small onion; squeeze out excess liquid with your hands or a towel.
Finely chop a small handful of mint; keep some leaves whole for garnish.
Dice 1 cucumber, 2 tomatoes, and 1 small red onion for the kachumber.
Lightly toast 3 tbsp chickpea flour in a dry pan over medium heat, stirring until nutty, 3–4 minutes; cool.
Crush 1 tsp coriander seeds in a mortar or under a pan to a coarse powder.
Cut and juice 2 lemons; reserve separately for kebabs and salad.
Line a baking tray with foil and place a lightly oiled oven-safe rack on top (for kebabs).
cook_steps: Make kebab mix (stovetop + bowl): In a large bowl, combine 800 g lamb mince, grated onion, minced garlic, 2 tbsp yoghurt, toasted chickpea flour, 2 tsp ground cumin, crushed coriander seeds, 2 tsp garam masala, 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper, 1 tsp black pepper, 1.5 tsp salt, 1 tbsp lemon juice, and 1 tbsp finely chopped mint. Mix by hand until sticky and well bound, 2–3 minutes.
Chill the mixture 20–30 minutes for easier shaping.
Start jeera rice (stovetop): Heat 2 tbsp ghee in a pot over medium heat. Add 2 tsp cumin seeds, 2 bay leaves, 4 cloves, and a small piece of cinnamon; sizzle 30 seconds until aromatic.
Add drained rice and gently stir to coat, 1 minute. Add 3 cups water and 1 tsp salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest 10 minutes covered.
Shape kebabs: With oiled hands, form 10–12 oval patties about 1.5 cm thick. Brush lightly with oil.
Roast kebabs (oven): Place patties on the preheated rack. Roast 10 minutes, flip, brush with a little ghee or oil, and roast 6–8 minutes more until just cooked and lightly charred at edges.

Make kachumber (stovetop optional for toasting cumin): In a bowl, combine diced cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion with 2 tbsp lemon juice, a pinch of salt, a pinch of black pepper, and 1/4 tsp ground cumin. Fold in a few chopped mint leaves.
Finish rice: Fluff with a fork; remove whole spices.
Finish kebabs: Squeeze a little lemon over the hot kebabs and sprinkle with chopped mint.
Plate: Mound jeera rice on a platter, arrange kebabs on top or alongside, and serve kachumber on the side. Garnish with mint leaves.
instructions: Preheat oven to 240°C/465°F with a rack in the upper third.
Rinse 2 cups basmati rice in cold water until it runs clear; soak 20 minutes, then drain.
Finely grate 1 small onion; squeeze out excess liquid with your hands or a towel.
Mince 4 cloves garlic.
Finely chop a small handful of mint; keep some leaves whole for garnish.
Dice 1 cucumber, 2 tomatoes, and 1 small red onion for the kachumber.
Lightly toast 3 tbsp chickpea flour in a dry pan over medium heat, stirring until nutty, 3–4 minutes; cool.
Crush 1 tsp coriander seeds in a mortar or under a pan to a coarse powder.
Cut and juice 2 lemons; reserve separately for kebabs and salad.
Line a baking tray with foil and place a lightly oiled oven-safe rack on top (for kebabs).

Make kebab mix (stovetop + bowl): In a large bowl, combine 800 g lamb mince, grated onion, minced garlic, 2 tbsp yoghurt, toasted chickpea flour, 2 tsp ground cumin, crushed coriander seeds, 2 tsp garam masala, 1/2 tsp cayenne pepper, 1 tsp black pepper, 1.5 tsp salt, 1 tbsp lemon juice, and 1 tbsp finely chopped mint. Mix by hand until sticky and well bound, 2–3 minutes.
Chill the mixture 20–30 minutes for easier shaping.
Start jeera rice (stovetop): Heat 2 tbsp ghee in a pot over medium heat. Add 2 tsp cumin seeds, 2 bay leaves, 4 cloves, and a small piece of cinnamon; sizzle 30 seconds until aromatic.
Add drained rice and gently stir to coat, 1 minute. Add 3 cups water and 1 tsp salt. Bring to a boil, then cover and simmer on low 12 minutes. Turn off heat and rest 10 minutes covered.
Shape kebabs: With oiled hands, form 10–12 oval patties about 1.5 cm thick. Brush lightly with oil.
Roast kebabs (oven): Place patties on the preheated rack. Roast 10 minutes, flip, brush with a little ghee or oil, and roast 6–8 minutes more until just cooked and lightly charred at edges.

Make kachumber (stovetop optional for toasting cumin): In a bowl, combine diced cucumber, tomatoes, and red onion with 2 tbsp lemon juice, a pinch of salt, a pinch of black pepper, and 1/4 tsp ground cumin. Fold in a few chopped mint leaves.
Finish rice: Fluff with a fork; remove whole spices.
Finish kebabs: Squeeze a little lemon over the hot kebabs and sprinkle with chopped mint.
Plate: Mound jeera rice on a platter, arrange kebabs on top or alongside, and serve kachumber on the side. Garnish with mint leaves.

ingredients.preparation: finely chopped, plus leaves for garnish

final_ingredients.preparation: finely chopped, plus leaves for garnish
